The number consumed was 1170. at kafka.utils.TestUtils$.fail(TestUtils.scala:382) at kafka.utils.TestUtils$.waitUntilTrue(TestUtils.scala:792) at kafka.utils.TestUtils$.pollRecordsUntilTrue(TestUtils.scala:768) at kafka.api.AbstractConsumerTest.consumeRecords(AbstractConsumerTest.scala:156) at kafka.api.PlaintextConsumerTest.testLowMaxFetchSizeForRequestAndPartition(PlaintextConsumerTest.scala:800)

Failed again with error: https://builds.apache.org/job/kafka-pr-jdk8-scala2.11/23947/testReport/kafka.api/PlaintextConsumerTest/testLowMaxFetchSizeForRequestAndPartition/

Error Message

org.scalatest.exceptions.TestFailedException: Timed out before consuming expected 2700 records. The number consumed was 1350.
Tricky to reproduce, passed 212 times in a row locally

stanislavkozlovski commented on pull request #7318: KAFKA-8264: Log more information on ConsumerTest consume timeout
URL: https://github.com/apache/kafka/pull/7318

This patch adds additional logging information on timeout of the `AbstractConsumerTest#consumeRecords` method. It is difficult to pinpoint the exact issue of timeouts in this method with flaky tests due to the difficulty in reproducing it. Adding more information will help us diagnose whether the consumer was constantly polling for records or whether it was stuck rebalancing.

Without more information, I can only guess what's causing the issue
